definition: xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes

to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
virtuoso piper wins a beauty/the xiao 箫 (mouth organ) virtuoso 萧史 won for his wife the beautiful daughter of Duke Mu of Qin 秦穆公
reed-pipe wind instrument and vertical bamboo flute

sentences.english: In Xiaojian leadership, swallow and others entering the fugitive.
sentences.chinese: 在簫劍的領導下，小燕子等人一起邁入亡命天涯之途。

sentences.english: Then raise pate, seeing at Xiao diagram south with alike eyes of black grape.
sentences.chinese: 然後擡起頭，用黑葡萄一樣的眼睛看着簫圖南。

sentences.english: The history of the Chinese flute and Xiao is the oldest one in all cultural forms .
sentences.chinese: 中國笛簫的歷史是所有文化形態中最古老的。

definition: guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
a beautiful woman/graceful and elegant posture/moon
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
lit. morning bell, evening drum, symbolizing monastic practice (idiom); fig. encouragement to study or progress
to cross (a road, an ocean etc)/to cut across
